page.title: 03CHANGES IN LIFE, LIMPSFIELD
page.content: A lady aged 79 is the third generation of her family to have lived in{Limpsfield.} Over the years the shops have changed and can no longer supply everything. Therefore people shop in{Oxted.}They also have to go there for medical aid. Only one of the three original pubs remain but there are sports and ex_service clubs. The organisation{ {"LINK"}helps the elderly and disabled. The inhabitants were farmers and farmhands until the railway provided transport for commuters. It is still a close-knit community - it accepts the retired and newcomers warmly. Crime has increased sharply. The houses have been adapted to meet modern requirements, but the external characteristics have been kept. The motorway has reduced heavy traffic through {Limpsfield village.}
